marketNews.title: Big BUMN Banks Plan Share Buyback
marketNews.content:
Key Takeaway
Although implementation is still awaiting shareholder approval, we see the share buyback plan as a short-term positive sentiment for the movement of these three BUMN bank stocks, considering the presence of net foreign outflow since the beginning of the year.
On the other hand, based on our calculations, the buyback fund allocation is relatively small compared to their free float market cap, so we believe that the long-term stock price movement of BUMN big banks will still be more influenced by the company's fundamental performance.

marketNews.title: Several DPR Members Plan to Propose Removing the Central Bank Governor
marketNews.content: Tempo reported on Monday (17/2) that several DPR members plan to propose to President Prabowo Subianto to dismiss the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, because he is considered not supporting government policy well. The Deputy Speaker of the DPR and senior Gerindra Party member, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, denied the news to Reuters and said there was no plan to remove Perry, while Perry has not yet commented on this issue. Previously, the DPR ratified the revision of DPR Regulation Number 1 of 2020 for the evaluation and dismissal of public officials appointed by the DPR, which includes judges in high courts, leaders of institutions such as the police and military, up to the KPK.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Issues Government Regulation on 100% Domestic Placement of Natural Resource Export Earnings
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto officially issued Government Regulation No. 8/2025 which mandates the placement of 100% of foreign exchange earnings from natural resource exports (DHE SDA) domestically for 12 months, effective March 1, 2025. This new regulation does not apply to the oil and gas sector, where the implementation of DHE SDA placement for this sector will still refer to Government Regulation No. 36/2023. With this rule revision, President Prabowo predicts that the foreign exchange earnings kept in domestic banks could increase by 80 billion US dollars in 2025. The new regulation also provides room for exporters to use the DHE placed in a special account for several purposes, which are: 1) exchange to Rupiah in the same bank for business operations; 2) payment of tax obligations, state revenues, and other obligations to the government; 3) payment of dividends in foreign currency; 4) payment for the procurement of goods and services that are not yet available domestically; and 5) repayment of loans for capital goods procurement in foreign currency.

marketNews.title: BPS Noted Trade Balance Surplus Increased in January 2025
marketNews.content: BPS noted that Indonesia's trade balance surplus increased to 3.45 billion US dollars in January 2025 (vs. January 2024: surplus of 2 billion US dollars, December 2024: surplus of 2.24 billion US dollars), exceeding consensus expectations of 1.91 billion US dollars. This result was driven by a decrease in imports by -2.67% YoY due to Rupiah depreciation and weakening purchasing power, while exports grew by +4.88% YoY.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on imported cars around April 2, 2025
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said on Friday (14/2) that he will announce new tariffs for imported cars around April 2, 2025. Although, Trump did not provide any details regarding the scope, tariff amount, and its impact on cars made under the free trade agreement between the US, Canada, and Mexico.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Revises Job Loss Guarantee (JKP) Program Regulations
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto officially issued Government Regulation No. 6/2025 which revises the implementation of the Job Loss Guarantee (JKP) program. In this revision, the amount of cash benefit provided increased to 60% of the monthly wage for 6 months, higher than the benefit regulated in the previous regulation, which was 45% of the monthly wage for the first 3 months and 25% of the monthly wage for the following 3 months. The JKP contribution rate also decreased from 0.46% of the monthly wage to 0.36% of the monthly wage, and there is no additional contribution from employers or workers. The wage amount used as the basis for contributions and benefits remains unchanged at a maximum level of 5 million Rupiah.

marketNews.title: Ministry of ESDM is Still Awaiting Coordination Regarding Freeport Indonesia Copper Concentrate Export Recommendation
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of ESDM, Tri Winarno, said on Friday (14/2) that they have not yet issued a recommendation letter regarding the extension of PT Freeport Indonesia's copper concentrate export permit which has expired since December 31, 2024. Nevertheless, the Vice Minister of ESDM, Yuliot Tanjung, mentioned that there is a possibility that the export permit extension will be granted, considering that the investigation results of the PT Freeport Indonesia smelter fire at KEK JIIPE, Gresik, were caused by force majeure and not intentional factors. Previously, Reuters reported that PT Freeport Indonesia would continue copper concentrate exports this month if it obtained a new export permit. Reuters sources mentioned that PT Freeport Indonesia will start loading cargo destined for China on Friday (14/2), with the hope that the company will receive the export permit by the end of February 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri Announces Share Buyback Plan Up to IDR 1.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) announced a share buyback plan with an allocation of funds up to ~1.2 trillion rupiah. This corporate action follows other BUMN big banks such as Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) and Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) which have announced share buyback plans with fund allocations of up to [3 trillion rupiah] and [905 billion rupiah] respectively. To discuss the plan, BMRI plans to hold an EGM on March 25, 2025, while BBRI on [March 24, 2025] and BBNI on [March 26, 2025]. The buyback period for each will last up to 12 months from the EGM approving the plan. In separate transactions, two directors of Bank Mandiri - [Agus Dwi Handaya] and [Alexandra Askandar] - purchased 800,000 and 310,000 BMRI shares respectively on February 10 and February 11, 2025, with average prices of 5,000 rupiah per share and 4,870 rupiah per share respectively. The total value of these two transactions reached ~5.5 billion rupiah. In today's trading, Monday (17/2), BMRI stock price strengthened by +5.85%, while BBRI and BBNI increased by +4.4% and +4.58% respectively.

tickerNews.title: Five CUAN Executives Buy 700,600 Shares
tickerNews.content: $CUAN: Five members of the board of directors and commissioners of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi - consisting of [Erwin Ciputra], [Michael], [Kartika Hendrawan], [Diana Arsiyanti], and [Daniel Jr. Lopez Laurente] - purchased a total of 700,600 CUAN shares at an average price of ~7,225 rupiah per share on February 14, 2025. The total value of these five transactions reached ~5.1 billion rupiah. Each board member and commissioner stated that the transaction was intended for investment.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Recorded IDR 4.7 Trillion Net Profit in January 2025
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded (bank only) net profit of 4.7 trillion rupiah in January 2025 (+5.8% YoY, +12% MoM), lower than the FY25F consolidated estimate consensus which projected growth of +7.7% YoY. This result was supported by a (bank only) NIM of 5.91% in January 2025 (+20 bps YoY, -12 bps MoM), better than management's FY25 consolidated guidance in the range of 5.7-5.8%. Meanwhile, (bank only) credit still grew robustly by +15% YoY in January 2025 (vs. January 2024: +14.3% YoY, December 2024: +13.6% YoY), higher than management's FY25 consolidated guidance projecting a slowdown to the range of +6-8% YoY. However, (bank only) CoC in January 2025 rose to 0.76% (vs. January 2024: 0.29%, December 2024: -0.61%), higher than management's FY25 consolidated guidance at 0.3%, caused by a temporary effect due to long holidays at the end of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Adjusts Precious Metal Refining and Purchase Agreement with BRMS Subsidiary and Signs Cooperation with United Tractors Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi through its subsidiary, PT Emas Murni Abadi, made an adjustment to the agreement with a subsidiary of Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), PT Linge Mineral Resources, related to the exploration of cooperation in refining and purchasing precious metals. In this agreement adjustment, the amount of precious metal that can be refined and purchased reaches 3,600 kg. Besides with the subsidiary of BRMS, HRTA also signed a precious metal purchase and sale cooperation agreement with an entity of United Tractors, PT Agincourt Resources, although the company did not elaborate further in the [information disclosure].

tickerNews.title: LABA Controller Transfers 55 Million Shares for Collateral to Support Business Development
tickerNews.content: $LABA: The controller of Green Power Group, PT Nev Stored Energy, transferred 55 million LABA shares at an average price of 230 rupiah per share on February 12, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~12.7 billion rupiah and was intended to guarantee the shares. After this [transaction], PT Nev Stored Energy's ownership in LABA decreased from 50.75% to 45.77%. In separate [information disclosure], LABA explained that the share pledge transaction was intended to obtain low-interest financing totaling 4 million US dollars from S2C Capital Group, with the funds obtained to be used to support LABA's business development. Most recently, LABA signed an agreement worth 171.6 billion rupiah with PT Safast Electric Vehicles to supply 4,000 battery units.

tickerNews.title: HATM Plans Rights Issue to Raise IDR 504-538 Billion for Loan Repayment and/or Capital Expenditure
tickerNews.content: $HATM: Habco Trans Maritima plans to conduct a rights issue of 1.68 billion new shares with an exercise price around 300-320 rupiah per share, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 19.35%. Potential fund acquisition is around 504-538 billion rupiah, intended for loan repayment and/or the company's capital expenditure. The cum rights date in the regular market and negotiation is April 15, 2025, with an indication that the rights trading period is April 22-28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Decreased by -1.1% YoY in January 2025, Targeting +2% YoY Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a decrease in cement sales volume of -1.1% YoY in January 2025, with market share increasing to 31% (vs. January 2024: 29.8%) due to the industry's sales volume decreasing by -5.1% YoY. Annually, INTP's sales volume in January 2025 decreased in almost all regions, with increases only occurring in Banten and Sumatra. Based on product segmentation, bagged cement and bulk cement sales volumes decreased by -0.1% YoY and -3.7% YoY respectively in January 2025. On a separate occasion, the Corporate Secretary of INTP, Dani Handajani, said that the company targeted performance growth of around +2% YoY in 2025, in line with the projection for domestic cement consumption growth this year in the range of +1-3% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Bank Permata Recorded IDR 3.6 Trillion Net Profit in 2024 (+38% YoY)
tickerNews.content: $BNLI: Bank Permata recorded a net profit of 781 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+76% YoY, -38% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 reaching 3.6 trillion rupiah (+38% YoY). This result was supported by a decrease in provision expenses to 334 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-52% YoY, +127% QoQ), so that provision expenses during 2024 totaled 1.5 trillion rupiah (-40% YoY). On the top-line, Net Interest Income (NII) increased to 2.6 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+2.5% YoY, +0.1% QoQ), so that NII during 2024 grew +2.3% YoY to 10.2 trillion rupiah.
